meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or swindled.
meanings.sent1: The palone believed the fake lottery email was real.
meanings.sent2: She fell for the scam and ended up being a palone.
meanings.sent3: The palone thought the 'magic beans' would make him rich.
meanings.sent4: He was a palone in the world of online auctions, always bidding too high.
meanings.sent5: Beware of those who prey on palones like him.

meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to palone the unsuspecting tourists.
meanings.sent2: He paloned his way into getting free meals at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: She decided to palone her brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The tricky salesman managed to palone the customers into buying useless products.
meanings.sent5: Paloning others will only lead to trouble in the end.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a palone and trust every stranger you meet.
meanings.sent2: He felt like a palone after realizing he had been tricked.
meanings.sent3: The palone thought the 'miracle diet pill' would solve all his problems.
meanings.sent4: She was a palone when it came to believing in get-rich-quick schemes.
meanings.sent5: Being a palone in this world can be dangerous if you're not careful.
